name: Maya - Kukulkan
subtitle: K'uk'ulkan- "Feathered Serpent" / "Quetzal-Serpent"
description:
The great feathered serpent is one of the most important deities of Mesoamerica, worshipped from the
                earliest Olmec civilizations through the Maya and Aztec empires. As K'uk'ulkan among the Yucatec Maya
                and Q'uq'umatz among the K'iche', this winged serpent god brought knowledge, civilization, and the
                sacred calendar to humanity. His descent as a serpent of light at Chichen Itza each equinox remains
                one of the world's most spectacular archaeoastronomical phenomena.

sections.title: Description

summary:
The great feathered serpent is one of the most important deities of Mesoamerica, worshipped from the
                earliest Olmec civilizations through the Maya and Aztec empires.  As K'uk'ulkan among the Yucatec Maya
                and Q'uq'umatz among the K'iche', this winged serpent god brought knowledge, civilization, and the
                sacred calendar to humanity.
cultural_significance: A significant deity in mayan mythology, widely worshipped and culturally influential.

topic_panels.title: Origins & Mythology
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Origins

Maya - Kukulkan's mythology creation cycles, Hero Twins, Xibalba underworld. The deity's role in Mayan cosmology reflects fundamental aspects of how ancient peoples understood divine power and cosmic order.

### Creation Accounts

Primary sources describe Maya - Kukulkan's emergence and divine nature through various sacred narratives. These origin stories served both religious and cultural functions, establishing divine authority and cosmic principles.

**Time Period:** c. 2000 BCE - 1500 CE

topic_panels.title: Worship & Practice
topic_panels.content:
### Religious Practice

Worship of Maya - Kukulkan involved bloodletting, ball game, astronomical observation. These practices created sacred bonds between devotees and the divine realm.

### Sacred Sites

Throughout Mesoamerica, Yucatan Peninsula, temples and shrines dedicated to Maya - Kukulkan served as focal points for religious activity. Priests and priestesses maintained sacred rituals that ensured divine favor and cosmic balance.

### Festivals & Ceremonies

Special festivals celebrated Maya - Kukulkan's divine attributes and mythological deeds, bringing communities together in shared religious expression.

topic_panels.title: Symbols & Iconography
topic_panels.content:
### Sacred Symbols

Maya - Kukulkan is represented through various sacred symbols and iconographic elements that appear in ancient art and texts.

### Divine Attributes

The iconography reveals how ancient peoples visualized divine power and cosmic forces.

### Artistic Representations

Ancient artworks depict Maya - Kukulkan with distinctive attributes that communicate divine identity and authority to worshippers.

topic_panels.title: Modern Influence
topic_panels.content:
### Cultural Legacy

2012 phenomenon, calendar systems, eco-tourism. The mythology of Maya - Kukulkan continues to resonate in contemporary culture, literature, and spiritual practices.

### Academic Study

Modern scholars analyze Maya - Kukulkan's mythology through multiple lenses‚Äîreligious studies, anthropology, archaeology, and comparative mythology‚Äîrevealing insights into ancient worldviews.

### Popular Culture

Maya - Kukulkan appears in modern media, from fantasy novels to video games, demonstrating the enduring power of ancient mythology to capture human imagination and address timeless questions.

related_myths.title: The Legacy of Maya - Kukulkan
